title: PHPis_link()Function

metadata.description: Learn about PHPis_link()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example
Check whether the specified filename is a symbolic link:
<?php
$link = "images";
if(is_link($link)) {
echo ("$link is a link");
} else {
echo ("$link is not a link");
}
?>
The output of the code above could be:
images is not a link
Definition and Usage
The is_link() function checks whether the specified filename is a symbolic link.
Note:
The result of this function is cached. Use
clearstatcache()
to clear the cache.
Syntax
is_link(
file
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
file
Required. Specifies the path to the file to check
Technical Details
Return Value:
TRUE if the file is a symbolic link, FALSE and an 
 E_WARNING otherwise
PHP Version:
4.0+

★
+1

summary: This tutorial covers PHPis_link()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use PHPis_link()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples.
